trans-unit.source: Provides low-level control for drawing text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] applications.
The FormattedText object allows you to draw multi-line text, in which each character in the text can be individually formatted.
The following example shows text that has several formats applied to it.

![Text displayed using FormattedText object](~/add/media/formattedtext01.jpg "Text displayed using FormattedText object") Example of a formatted text string In terms of text features in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)], FormattedText is considered "low-level" because it processes text as graphical elements.

Other aspects of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] handle text in the context of controls that are dedicated to text (<xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox>), implement the flow document model (see [Flow Document Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)), or support the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document model (see [Documents in WPF](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)).

Many of the setter methods in FormattedText have similarities to attached properties that are supported by <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, but the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> attached properties apply to the higher-level text support either for flow or [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, and brush.
The text to be displayed.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size the text should be formatted at.
The brush used to paint the each glyph.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, foreground brush, and pixelsPerDip value.
The text to be displayed.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size for the text's em measure, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The brush used to paint the each glyph.
The Pixels Per Density Independent Pixel value, which is the equivalent of the scale factor.
For example, if the DPI of a screen is 120 (or 1.25 because 120/96 = 1.25) , 1.25 pixel per density independent pixel is drawn.
DIP is the unit of measurement used by WPF to be independent of device resolution and DPIs.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, brush, and number substitution behavior.
The text to be displayed.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size for the text's em measure, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The brush used to paint the each glyph.
The number substitution behavior to apply to the text.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, foreground brush, number substitution behavior, and pixelsPerDip value.
The text to display.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size for the text's em measure, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The brush used to paint the each glyph.
Specifies how numbers in text are displayed, based on <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref>.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The Pixels Per Density Independent Pixel value, which is the equivalent of the scale factor.
For example, if the DPI of a screen is 120 (or 1.25 because 120/96 = 1.25) , 1.25 pixel per density independent pixel is drawn.
DIP is the unit of measurement used by WPF to be independent of device resolution and DPIs.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, brush, number substitution behavior, and text formatting mode.
The text to be displayed.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size for the text's em measure, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The brush used to paint the each glyph.
The number substitution behavior to apply to the text.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormattingMode"></xref> to apply to the text.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> class with the specified text, culture, flow direction, typeface, font size, foreground brush, number substitution behavior, and pixelsPerDip value.
The text to display.
The specific culture of the text.
The direction the text is read.
The font family, weight, style and stretch the text should be formatted with.
The font size for the text's em measure, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
he brush used to paint the each glyph.
Specifies how numbers in text are displayed, based on <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref>.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The formatting mode that affects how WPF displays text.
The Pixels Per Density Independent Pixel value, which is the equivalent of the scale factor.
For example, if the DPI of a screen is 120 (or 1.25 because 120/96 = 1.25) , 1.25 pixel per density independent pixel is drawn.
DIP is the unit of measurement used by WPF to be independent of device resolution and DPIs.
Gets the distance from the top of the first line to the baseline of the first line of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The distance from the top of the first line to the baseline of the first line, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object that represents the formatted text, including all glyphs and text decorations.
When text is converted to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object, it is no longer a collection of characters—you cannot modify the characters in the text string.
However, you can affect the appearance of the converted text by modifying its stroke and fill properties.
The following examples illustrate several ways of creating visual effects by modifying the stroke and fill of converted text.

![Text with different colors for fill and stroke](~/add/media/outlinedtext03.jpg "Text with different colors for fill and stroke") Example of setting stroke and fill to different colors ![Text with image brush applied to stroke](~/add/media/outlinedtext04.jpg "Text with image brush applied to stroke") Example of an image brush applied to the stroke Text that is converted to and rendered as a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object may not look the same as text rendered directly: - Text converted to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object is not rendered using ClearType.
In addition, the baseline of the converted is not snapped to a whole display pixel.
- Small fonts, such as those commonly used in body text, may lose legibility, appear blurred, and vary in appearance.
The top-left origin of the resulting geometry.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object representation of the formatted text.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object that represents the highlight bounding box of the formatted text.
The bounding box region contains the entire formatted text area starting at the point specified by `origin`.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object contains only the bounding box of the highlighted text and does not contain any rendered text.
The following example illustrates a way to creating visual effects by modifying the stroke and highlight of converted text.
![Text with image brush applied to stroke](~/add/media/outlinedtext05.jpg "Text with image brush applied to stroke") Example of an image brush applied to the stroke and highlight
The origin of the highlight region.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object that represents the highlight bounding box of the formatted text.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object that represents the highlight bounding box for a specified substring of the formatted text.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object contains only the bounding box of the highlighted text and does not contain any rendered text.
The origin of the highlight region.
The index of the initial character the highlight bounds should be obtained for.
The number of characters the highlight bounds should contain.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object that represents the highlight bounding box of the formatted text substring.
Gets the distance from the topmost drawn pixel of the first line to the bottommost drawn pixel of the last line.
Extent incorporates any graphical elements that might be present in a glyph, including decorative elements that might go outside the line height, baseline, or overhangs.
This value is dependent on characters appearing on the line and is thus not used (and should not be used) to derive line spacing.
It can however be used to align the top or bottom of paragraphs with graphical elements, or for hit-testing.
The distance from the topmost drawn pixel of the first line to the bottommost drawn pixel of the last line, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref> of the formatted text.
Retrieves an array of text widths.
Each element in the array represents the maximum text width of sequential lines of text.
If the text lines exceed the number of elements in the array, the last element value is used for the remaining lines.
If the array of lengths is not `null`, the array values of GetMaxTextWidths are used instead of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.MaxTextWidth%2A> property value.
An array of maximum text widths, each width provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the distance from the top of the first line to the bottom of the last line of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The distance from the top of the first line to the bottom of the last line, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the line height, or line spacing, between lines of text.
The default line height is automatically calculated, and is based on the font value that is passed as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The line spacing between lines of text, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets or sets the maximum number of lines to display.
Text exceeding the MaxLineCount will not be displayed.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.Trimming%2A> property to control how omitted text is represented when the text exceeds the MaxLineCount.
The maximum number of lines to display.
Gets or sets the maximum height of a text column.

The last line of text displayed is the last whole line that will fit within the MaxTextHeight limit or the line number that does not exceed the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.MaxLineCount%2A> property, whichever occurs first.
The maximum height of a text column, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets or sets the maximum text width (length) for a line of text.
Text will wrap to avoid exceeding the MaxTextWidth limit.
Glyph alignment edges must be kept within the line count limits.
Because many fonts contain glyphs that slightly overhang their alignment edges, allow at least 1/6 em (font size) margin beyond the line count requested, to leave room for such overhangs.
A zero value for line count is treated as an infinite line count.
The maximum text width for a line of text, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the smallest possible text width that can fully contain the specified text content.
The following illustrated text uses the minimum text width for the source text, which displays as multiple lines.
The minimum text width corresponds to the word that has the greatest width—in this case, the word "jumped".
Notice that multiple words can appear on the same line, as long as their total width does not exceed the minimum text width.

![Text Formatter using the minimum paragraph width](~/add/media/textformatter03.png "Text Formatter using the minimum paragraph width") Minimum text width If the value passed to <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.MaxTextWidth%2A> is greater than or equal to the value of MinWidth, the text is formatted without ellipsis characters.
The minimum text width of the text source, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the distance from the bottom of the last line of text to the bottommost drawn pixel.
The value is positive if the bottommost drawn pixel goes below the line bottom, and is negative if it is within (on or above) the line.
The distance from the bottom of the last line to the bottommost inked pixel, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the maximum distance from the leading alignment point to the leading drawn pixel of a line.
When the leading alignment point comes before the leading drawn pixel, the value is negative.
The maximum distance from the leading alignment point to the leading drawn pixel of a line, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the maximum distance from the trailing inked pixel to the trailing alignment point of a line.
The OverhangTrailing value will be positive when the trailing drawn pixel comes before the trailing alignment point.
The maximum distance from the trailing inked pixel to the trailing alignment point of a line, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Get or sets the PixelsPerDip at which the text should be rendered.
The current PixelsPerDip value.
Sets the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> class holds culture-specific information, such as the associated language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and cultural conventions.

This class also provides access to culture-specific instances of <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo>, <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo>, and <xref:System.Globalization.TextInfo>.
These objects contain the information required for culture-specific operations, such as casing, formatting dates and numbers, and comparing strings.
This method sets the culture information value for the entire text string.

To set the culture information value for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetCulture%28System.Globalization.CultureInfo%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> to use for text formatting.
Sets the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> class holds culture-specific information, such as the associated language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and cultural conventions.

This class also provides access to culture-specific instances of <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo>, <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo>, and <xref:System.Globalization.TextInfo>.
These objects contain the information required for culture-specific operations, such as casing, formatting dates and numbers, and comparing strings.
To set the culture information value for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetCulture%28System.Globalization.CultureInfo%29> method.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> to use for text formatting.
The start index of initial character to apply the change to.
The number of characters the change should be applied to.
Sets the font family for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
This method sets the font family value for the entire text string.
To set the font family value for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontFamily%28System.String%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
A string that constructs the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> to use for text formatting.
Fallbacks are permitted; for details, see <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
Sets the font family for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
This method sets the font family value for the entire text string.
To set the font family value for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontFamily%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> to use for text formatting.
Sets the font family for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
To set the font family value for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontFamily%2A> method.
A string that constructs the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> to use for text formatting.
Fallbacks are permitted; for details, see <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
The starting index of the initial character to apply the font family change to.
The number of characters the change should apply to.
Sets the font family for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
To set the font family value for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontFamily%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> to use for text formatting.
The starting index of the initial character to apply the font family change to.
The number of characters the change should apply to.
Sets the font size for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
This method sets the font size value for the entire text string.
To set the font size value for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontSize%2A> method.
The font 'em' measure size, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Sets the font size for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
To set the font size value for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontSize%2A> method.
The font 'em' measure size, provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The start index of the initial character to apply the font size to.
The number of characters to apply the font size to.
Sets the font stretch value for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The font stretch value refers to the degree to which a font is stretched on the screen.

<xref:System.Windows.FontStretch> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStretches> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
You can also call <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch.FromOpenTypeStretch%2A> to create a properly initialized <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
This method sets the font stretch value for the entire text string.
To set the font stretch value for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontStretch%28System.Windows.FontStretch%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The desired <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> value to use for text formatting.
Sets the font stretch value for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The font stretch value refers to the degree to which a font is stretched on the screen.

<xref:System.Windows.FontStretch> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStretches> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
You can also call <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch.FromOpenTypeStretch%2A> to create a properly initialized <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
To set the font stretch value for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontStretch%28System.Windows.FontStretch%29> method.
The desired <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> value to use for text formatting.
The start index of the initial character to apply the font stretch to.
The number of characters to apply the font stretch to.
Sets the font style for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>.
This method sets the font style for the entire text string.
To set the font style for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontStyle%28System.Windows.FontStyle%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> value to use for text formatting.
Sets the font style for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>.
To set the font style for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontStyle%28System.Windows.FontStyle%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> value to use for text formatting.
The start index of the initial character to apply the font style to.
The number of characters to apply the font style to.
Sets the font typeface for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> represents a combination of <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily>, <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>, <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>, and <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> supports multiple constructors, one of which constructs based on a typeface name, another of which takes discrete values for <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily>, <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>, <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>, and <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
This method sets the font typeface for the entire text string.
To set the font typeface for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontTypeface%28System.Windows.Media.Typeface%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Typeface"></xref> to use for text formatting.
Sets the font typeface for a specified subset of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> represents a combination of <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily>, <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>, <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>, and <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> supports multiple constructors, one of which constructs based on a typeface name, another of which takes discrete values for <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily>, <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>, <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle>, and <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch>.
To set the font typeface for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetFontTypeface%28System.Windows.Media.Typeface%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Typeface"></xref> to use for text formatting.
The start index of the initial character to apply the typeface to.
The number of characters to apply the typeface to.
Sets the font weight for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontWeights> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to use for text formatting.
Changes the <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> for specified text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.

<xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> supports type conversion behavior such that static values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontWeights> class can be used to initialize <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> and fill parameters that are type <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>.
The font weight to use for text formatting.
The start index of the initial character to apply the font weight to.
The number of characters to apply the font weight to.
Changes the foreground <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> for an entire <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
This method sets the foreground brush for the entire text string.
To set the foreground brush for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetForegroundBrush%28System.Windows.Media.Brush%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The brush to use for the text foreground.
Changes the foreground <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> for specified text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
To set the foreground brush for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetForegroundBrush%2A> method.
The brush to use for the text foreground.
The start index of the initial character to apply the foreground brush to.
The number of characters to apply the foreground brush to.
Sets an array of maximum text widths within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref>, on a per-line basis.
Each element in the array represents the maximum text width of sequential lines of text.
If the text lines exceed the number of elements in the array, the last value in the array is used for the remaining lines.
Providing a valid array SetMaxTextWidths will override any value provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.MaxTextWidth%2A> property.
An array of maximum text widths, each width provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Sets the number substitution behavior for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> class specifies how numbers in text are to be displayed.
This method sets the number substitution behavior for the entire text string.

To set the number substitution behavior for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetNumberSubstitution%28System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.

Number substitution behavior to apply to the text; can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, in which case the default number substitution method for the text culture is used.
Sets the number substitution behavior for specified text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> class specifies how numbers in text are to be displayed.
To set the number substitution behavior for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetNumberSubstitution%28System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution%29> method.

Number substitution behavior to apply to the text; can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, in which case the default number substitution method for the text culture is used.
The start index of initial character to apply the change to.
The number of characters the change should be applied to.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> for the entire set of characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> class specifies the types of text decorations to apply to the text.
There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline.
These are described as <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationLocation> values that are set on each item in the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection>.

It is common that the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> collection contains only one decoration, but the property uses the collection to provide for more advanced decoration effects by applying multiple decorations to the same text.
The following illustration shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.

![Diagram of text decoration locations](~/add/media/textdecoration01.gif "Diagram of text decoration locations") Example of text decoration types This method sets the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> for the entire text string.

To set the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> for a subset of the text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetTextDecorations%28System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> to apply to the text.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> for specified text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> class specifies the types of text decorations to apply to the text.
There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline.
These are described as <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationLocation> values that are set on each item in the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection>.

It is common that the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> collection contains only one decoration, but the property uses the collection to provide for more advanced decoration effects by applying multiple decorations to the same text.
The following illustration shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.

![Diagram of text decoration locations](~/add/media/textdecoration01.gif "Diagram of text decoration locations") Example of text decoration types To set the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection> for the entire text string, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText.SetTextDecorations%28System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> to apply to the text.
The start index of the initial character to apply the text decorations to.
The number of characters to apply the text decorations to.
Gets the string of text to be displayed.
This property is not settable on a constructed <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText> object.
You must construct a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText> in order to set different text.
The string of text to be displayed.
Gets or sets the alignment of text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextAlignment"></xref> values that specifies the alignment of text within a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FormattedText"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the means by which the omission of text is indicated.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextTrimming"></xref> values that specifies how the omission of text is indicated.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.TextTrimming"></xref>.
Gets the width between the leading and trailing alignment points of a line, excluding any trailing white-space characters.
For multi-line text, the longest line is used for the Width value.
The width between the leading and trailing alignment points of a line, excluding any trailing white-space characters.
Provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Gets the width between the leading and trailing alignment points of a line, including any trailing white-space characters.
For multi-line text, the longest line is used for the WidthIncludingTrailingWhitespace value.
The width between the leading and trailing alignment points of a line, including any trailing white-space characters.
Provided in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
